tool.name: Differntially Methylated Position Finder

configfiles.configfile:
### code chunk: Load all required libraries quietly library('minfi', quietly=TRUE, warn.conflicts=FALSE,verbose = FALSE) library('IlluminaHumanMethylation450k.db'quietly=TRUE, warn.conflicts=FALSE,verbose = FALSE) ## Load the RGset data if(!is.null("${RGset}")){ load("${RGset}") }
## Get beta values beta = getBeta(RGset)
## Set phenotype data pd = pData(RGset) phenotype = pd\$status
files = gsub(".+/","",pd\$filenames)
dmp = dmpFinder(dat=beta,pheno=phenotype,type="categorical",shrinkVar="${shrinkVar}")
write.table(dmp,file="dmpfinder_result.txt",quote=FALSE,row.names=TRUE)

param.name: RGset
param.label: Input RGset for finding Differentially methylated positions

tool.help:
**What it does**
This function tests each genomic position for association between methylation and a phenotype. Continuous phenotypes are tested with linear regression, while an F-test is used for categorical phenotypes. Currently works only for categorical data.
Variance shrinkage (shrinkVar=TRUE) is recommended when sample sizes are small(less than 10). This is only for Illumina 450k Arrays.
**Input** :
*RGset* : An RGset produced from reading in IDAT files using "Read Illumina 450k IDAT". RGSet is a RGChannelSet object, which contains the raw data from the IDAT files: green intensities and red intensities.
The RGset should have the phenotype to be tested for association with methylation. The phenotype is given when giving the names to the dataset collections.
You can generate an RGset for you Illumina 450k arrys (IDAT files) using the tool to "Read Illumina 450k IDAT". You can find detailed instructions on how to use tool in the help section for the tool.
*Should variance shrinkage be used?*: The sample variances are squeezed by computing empirical Bayes posterior means using the limma package.
NOTE: Make sure the RGset is normalized, otherwise the result wouldn't make too much sense.
**Output**:
A table with one row per CpG.
